column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#Text=As a result, it was found out that most of the HA molecules remained undigested when treated with each of these proteases in the absence of urea.
#Text=The HA molecules, which had been denatured with urea, employed as a substrate were not digested with V8 protease, thermolysin and pronase.
#Text=When lysyl endopeptidase, chymotrypsin and subtilisin were used, the digestion proceeded excessively and the antigenicity for AI3C completely disappeared.
#Text=When proteinase K was used, on the other hand, it was confirmed that the HA molecules were digested and polypeptide fragments having an avidity for AI3C were formed.
#Text=(3) Preparation of Stem Region Polypeptide

#Text=To the FHA molecules (250 .mu.g/1400 .mu.l) prepared in Example 9-(1) were successively added 100 .mu.l of 1 M Tris-HCl (pH 7.6) and 500 .mu.l of 8 M urea and the resulting mixture was maintained at 42.degree.
#Text=C. for 1 hour.
#Text=To this solution was added 2000 .mu.l of an immobilized Proteinase K gel and maintained at 37.degree.
#Text=C. for 7 hours under shaking.
#Text=After centrifuging, the reaction mixture thus obtained was dialyzed against PBS for 12 hours and thus the stem region polypeptide was obtained.
#Text=(4) Properties of Stem Region Polypeptide
#Text=By using the stem region polypeptide of Example 9-(3) as a test sample, the antigenicity for AI3C was examined by the ELISA method.
#Text=Namely, a diluted solution of the stem region polypeptide was added to a microtiter plate (Maxi Sorp; manufactured by Nunc) and immobilized at 37.degree.
#Text=C. for 90 minutes.
#Text=Then blocking was effected by using Block Ace (manufactured by Snow Brand Milk Products).

#Text=Then these cells were continuously reacted with 2 antibodies [10 mg/ml AI3C solution diluted 200-fold, and peroxidase-labeled goat anti-mouse immunoglobulin G solution (manufactured by Cappel) diluted 500-fold] each for 90 minutes and the cells thus treated were washed with PBS.
#Text=Finally, the peroxidase reaction was effected by using 0.03% H2O2 and 1 mg/ml of o-phenylenediamine dihydrochloride in citric acid/phosphoric acid (pH 5.2).
#Text=The amount of the antigen was calculated from the absorbance of the reaction mixture at 492 nm.
#Text=As a standard, HA molecules described in Example 9-(1) were used.
#Text=As the result of the ELISA method, it has been proved that this stem region polypeptide has an antigenicity comparable to that of HA molecules.
#Text=The hemagglutination activity (HA value) of the stem region polypeptide was determined in the following manner.
#Text=On a U-shaped 96-well microtiter plates (Falcon 3911: manufactured by Becton Dickinson Labware), the sample solution was diluted with PBS in two steps.
#Text=Then the same amount of a 0.5% avian erythrocyte suspension was added thereto and the mixture was stirred well.
#Text=After reacting at room temperature for 1 hour, agglutination of the erythrocytes was observed.
#Text=The highest dilution ratio showing agglutination was taken as the HA value.
